name: immaculacy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being immaculate (= perfect, clean, or without any mistakes): The new album tends to favour proficiency and glossy immaculacy. One should never expect immaculacy from a pioneering artist breaking new ground.
More examplesFewer examplesIn this live recording, they swap the symphonic immaculacy of their great studio recordings for something much more ragged.The prose does not shift an inch from its superb, unfeeling immaculacy. The lighting emphasizes the strange flatness of his skin and its pale immaculacy.
